0P00015E4A.L.manager_bio:
Christopher Moore joined Fidelity in 2005 as a Pan European equity analyst working on mid cap stocks before transitioning to large-cap utility stocks. He was sector leader for natural resources, energy and utilities from 2007 to 2009, which included managing a pilot fund comprising stocks in these three sectors. Between 2009 and 2010, he was Director of Research for the emerging markets, consumer and healthcare teams. During this time, Christopher managed a model portfolio of emerging market stocks with a significant exposure to the energy and metals & mining sectors. For the last few months of 2010 Christopher focused solely on energy and metals and mining stocks.
Christopher managed the Fidelity Funds Global Industrials Fund jointly with Angel Agudo before assuming sole responsibility for the fund in April 2012.
Prior to joining Fidelity, Christopher spent two years as an Economic Consultant at Deloitte & Touche and four years as a Consultant with Arthur Andersen. He has an MBA from Said Business School, Oxford, and a BA in Philosophy, Politics & Economics from University College Oxford.

0P0001HPJ9.L.manager_bio:
Toby is the Chief Executive Officer of Margetts Fund Management Ltd., joined in 1994. Margetts led the development of multi-manager risk rated funds having launched their flagship range in the early 1990s which became a popular concept adopted by many investment houses subsequently. The Margetts Risk Rated funds and a number of third party mandates are managed by Toby and the Margetts investment team who also provide independent investment research relating to collective investment schemes and market commentary through the Margetts Research website. Toby also works with various independent financial advisers, networks and consultants to provide fund management advice and oversight as well as being a regular speaker on investment, market and related regulatory matters.

Toby is now widely regarded as a leading professional in collective investment management, being regularly profiled in the major financial publications and national press. Toby is the lead manager of the award winning Risk Rated fund of funds and is recognised by Citywire as one of the top10 most consistent managers over the past decade. Toby is the Chief Executive Officer of Margetts Fund Management Ltd.

It is expected that investments in equities of emerging marketâs companies will not exceed 70% of the Portfolio's net asset value. It is expected that investments in liquid assets, money markets instruments and bonds of any kind will not exceed 40% of the Portfolio's net assets.

ROBB.AS.long_name: Robeco Sustainable Global Stars Equities Fund EUR G
ROBB.AS.summary:
The aim of the Sub-fund is to provide long term capital growth.
The Sub-fund will take exposure of at least two-thirds of its total assets to equities of companies all over the world. The Sub-fund will take exposure of at least two-thirds of its total assets to equities of companies that mainly operate in mature economies (developed market). The Sub-fund's portfolio has a focused, concentrated portfolio with a small number of larger bets.
Sustainability means striving to achieve economic success, while at the same time considering environmental, social and governance criteria. For the assessment, areas like corporate strategy, corporate governance, transparency as well as the product and service range of a company are taken into account.

ROMF.AS.long_name: Robeco QI Global Multi-Factor Equities Fund G â‚¬
ROMF.AS.summary: The investment objective of the fund is aimed at achieving long-term value growth. The fund mainly invests in stocks that are attractive according to one or more quantitative factor strategies. Examples of this is a strategy that takes advantage of the premium in stocks with lower risk (Conservative), a strategy that profits from a premium in stocks with attractive valuation (Value) and a strategy that takes advantage of the premium of stocks that have a favorable price development (Momentum)
ROMF.AS.manager_bio: Joop Huij, Portfolio Manager, Head of Factor Investing Equities and Head of Factor Indexing Research, is responsible for Value-, Momentum-, Quality- and Multi-Factor Equities strategies, and Factor Indexes. Joop also holds a part-time position as Associate Professor (with tenure) of Finance at Rotterdam School of Management. He has published in various academic journals including the Journal of Banking and Finance, Journal of Empirical Finance, Journal of Financial Markets, and Financial Analyst Journal. Joop started his career as a researcher in 2007. He holds a PhD in Finance from Rotterdam School of Management and a Masterâs in Informatics & Economics (cum laude) from Erasmus University Rotterdam.

ROQI.AS.long_name: Robeco QI Global Developed Enhanced Index Equities Fund - EUR G
ROQI.AS.summary: The Robeco QI Global Developed Enhanced Index Equities Fund uses a quantitative stock selection strategy to invest in global equities from developed markets, with a low tracking error relative to the MSCI World index, which serves as the benchmark for the fund. The portfolio is widely spread. Stock selection is the key performance driver. The fund systematically neutralizes sector, region and country exposures. Stock selection within the fund is entirely based on Robeco's proprietary quantitative stock selection model. This model ranks stocks on their expected future relative performance using three factors: valuation, responsible management and sentiment.
ROQI.AS.manager_bio: Mr. Strating, Senior Vice President, is Head of Disciplined Equity with the Robeco group of companies.He has been a Portfolio Manager at Robeco since 1990. Previously, he was Portfolio Manager of the Institutional Global Equity portfolios. Prior to that, he held a position as portfolio Manager of European Equities with Robeco. Mr. Strating is a graduate from the Erasmus University Rotterdam and holds a Master's degree in Law and a Master's degree in Business Economics from Erasmus University Rotterdam.

SWIF.AS.summary: The objective of the Fund is to achieve a return that is as close as possible to the return on the Dow Jones Sustainability World Developed ex Korea Diversified Select Index.
